A helper class that helps prevent reentrancy into certain functions. More...

Public Member Functions

 ReentrancyPreventer ()
 ~ReentrancyPreventer ()
 operator bool () const
 Returns true if the global counter is 1 (that is, only one globally active instance of this class exists throughout the application), and false otherwise. If false is returned, you can then abort your function early as a reentrancy condition has been detected.

Static Public Attributes

static volatile int ct = 0

Detailed Description

A helper class that helps prevent reentrancy into certain functions.

Mainly StimApp::loadStim(), StimApp::unloadStim(), and StimApp::pickOutputDir() make use of this class to prevent recursive calls into themselves.

Functions that want to be mutually exclusive with respect to each other and non-reentrant with respect to themselves need merely construct an instance of this class as a local variable, and then reentrancy into the function can be guarded by checking against this class's operator bool() function.

Definition at line 400 of file StimApp.cpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ReentrancyPreventer::ReentrancyPreventer (  )  [inline]

Increments a global counter. The global counter is 1 if only 1 instance of this class exists throughout the application, and >1 otherwise.

Definition at line 405 of file StimApp.cpp.

References ct.

ReentrancyPreventer::~ReentrancyPreventer (  )  [inline]

Decrements the global counter. If it reaches 0 this was the last instance of this class and there are no other ones active globally.

Returns true if the global counter is 1 (that is, only one globally active instance of this class exists throughout the application), and false otherwise. If false is returned, you can then abort your function early as a reentrancy condition has been detected.
